com.percussion.cas
Class PSAddAssemblerInfo

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.cas.PSAddAssemblerInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSExtension, IPSResultDocumentProcessor
public class PSAddAssemblerInfo
extends Object
implements IPSResultDocumentProcessor

This post exit adds information needed in content assembler stylesheets to the result document. A XML document conforming to the DTD sys_AssemblerInfo.dtd is created and inserted into the result document as its first child. In the second part the exit modifies the assembly style sheets to add extra links to edit the related content in preview or WYSIWYG mode. TO DO: the style sheet transformation is now performed every time the assembly page requested for edit-preview. It would be required to cache thisusing the datetime stamps on the original style sheet files and transform only if the destination stylesheets do not exist or source files are modfied.

Field Detail

ms_paramCount

public static int ms_paramCount
The number of parameters provided for this exit. Initially set to NOT_INITIALIZED to reflect that the #init(IPSExtensionDef, File) method has not been called yet. Is set during the first call to #init( IPSExtensionDef, File).

ASSEMBLY_RECURSION_MAP_KEY

public static final String ASSEMBLY_RECURSION_MAP_KEY
String constant to retrieve and modify the map of previously assembled snippets and their parent contexts. The key and value both follow the pattern described in makeKeyFromRequestContext(IPSRequestContext).

Method Detail

canModifyStyleSheet

public boolean canModifyStyleSheet()
Description copied from interface: IPSResultDocumentProcessor
Is the processResultDocument method implemented by this class capable of modifying the style sheet? If the method can change the style sheet by setting the XML-stylesheet processing instruction, this method returns true. If the method never attempts to modify the XML-stylesheet processing instruction, this method returns false. This answer helps the designer understand the implications of calling this extension.

Specified by:
canModifyStyleSheet in interface IPSResultDocumentProcessor
Returns:
true if the processResultDocument method may modify the XML-stylesheet processing instruction

init

public void init(IPSExtensionDef extensionDef,
                 File file)
          throws PSExtensionException
Description copied from interface: IPSExtension
Initializes this extension.

Note that the extension will have permission to read and write any files or directiors under codeRoot (recursively). The extension will not have permissions for any other files or directories.

Specified by:
init in interface IPSExtension
Parameters:
extensionDef - The extension def, which contains configuration info and initialization params.
file - The root directory where this extension should install and look for any files relating to itself. The subdirectory structure under codeRoot is left up to the extension implementation. Must not be null.
Throws:
PSExtensionException - If the codeRoot does not exist, or is not accessible. Also thrown for any other initialization errors that will prohibit this extension from doing its job correctly, such as invalid or missing properties.

processResultDocument

public Document processResultDocument(Object[] params,
                                      IPSRequestContext request,
                                      Document doc)
                               throws PSParameterMismatchException,
                                      PSExtensionProcessingException
This will make an internal request to the sys_ceSupport/AssemblerProperties resource to get all assembler properties defined for the siteid and contextid provided. All returned property name/value pairs will be added to the result document so they are available for the rendering stylesheet.

Specified by:
processResultDocument in interface IPSResultDocumentProcessor
Parameters:
params - no parameters are expected.
request - the request context object
doc - the result XML document, can be null
Returns:
the processed document. If no changes are made, returns the resultDoc which was passed in. If null is returned, the HTTP status code 404, file not found, will be returned to the caller of this method.
Throws:
PSParameterMismatchException - if a call to setParamValues was never made, or the runtime parameters specified in that call are incorrect for the usage of this extension.
PSExtensionProcessingException

appendNewAssemblyLevelParam

public static String appendNewAssemblyLevelParam(IPSRequestContext request,
                                                 String assemblyUrlString)
Add the assembly level parameter to the supplied variant URL. Does not validate the URL. Just appends the parameter (name=value) at the end of the URL string with an appropriate parameter separator(? or &). Does not check if the parameter already exists in the URL. The new assembly parameter value is the current assembly level value read from the request (see readCurrentAssemblyLevel(IPSRequestContext)) incremented by 1.

Parameters:
request - request context, must not be null.
assemblyUrlString - the unencoded URL string to append the assembly level parameter, may be null or empty.
Returns:
the assembly URL value after appending the new assembly level as a special parameter. May be null or empty if supplied URL sting is null or empty.

getChildElement

public static Element getChildElement(Element parent,
                                      String child)
Helper function to return the first child element with given name of a given parent.

Parameters:
parent, - parent element - may be null in which case the return value will be null
child, - child element name may be null in which case the return value will be null
Returns:
Child element as described above, may be null.
